structure.unit: ESCAPE AND OTHER OFFENSES RELATING TO CUSTODY

law.catch_line: Hindering prosecution or apprehension in the first degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of hindering prosecution or apprehension in the first degree when, with the intent to hinder the apprehension, prosecution, conviction or punishment of another whom he knows is being sought in connection with the commission of a capital offense or Class A felony, he renders assistance to such person.
Hindering prosecution or apprehension in the first degree is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 180, effective January 1, 1975.
